Defines the generic position type of this entry.
Input is optional as not all accounting activities update PM e.g. accruals which take place during end of day and will be absorbed into the account balances.
To update PM the POSN.TYPE field of the PD record of PM.PC.PARAM must also be set up with the same value.
Must exist on PM.POSN.TYPE which contains all generic position types.
Optional input 3 character Alphabetic. Must exist on PM.POSN.TYPE.
Identifies the type of amount allowed in the Payment Due module.
There are a fixed number of basic allowable types but these may be further subdivided by the users to allow greater control if so desired.
The base types that are allowed are:

(a) PR - PRincipal (b) IN - INterest (c) CH - CHarge (d) CO - COmmission (e) TX - TaX (f) A1-A5 - Additional types as defined in the Mortgages application (g) PE - PEnalty interest (h) PS - Penalty Spread
It is possible to define extra types of up to six characters but the first two characters have to be one of the above base types, so valid types would be "PRSPEC" or "TXLOC".
It is also possible to define types by category, the format of which is the amount type followed by a '-' and then the category code, e.g. "PR-21050" or "INEXT-25000".
It is important to remember that the base type must exist before any extra types can be defined.
2-12 alphanumeric type A characters in the format 2-6 characters optionally followed by a "-" and then a valid CATEGORY code. (Mandatory input).
First two characters must be one of the folowing: PR, IN, CH, CO, TX, A1, A2, A3, A4, A5, PE, PS.
If the amount type entered is greater than two characters then the first two characters must be one of the above types.
If a category code is entered then it must be a valid code on the CATEGORY table.
